briefdescription.para: Enum defining a list of independent variables on which the aerodynamic coefficients can depend.

detaileddescription.para: Enum defining a list of independent variables on which the aerodynamic coefficients can depend. Note that for a custom coefficient interface with other variables, you may use the undefined_independent_variable variable type, but at the expense of being able to use the FlightConditions class to automatically updates the aerodynamic coefficients during propagation.

briefdescription.para: Enum of all the possible independent variables on which the atmosphere can depend.

briefdescription.para: Enum of all the possible dependent variables that an atmosphere can describe.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double dynamicPressure, const double referenceArea, const Eigen::Vector3d &aerodynamicCoefficients, const double vehicleMass)
memberdef.name: computeAerodynamicAcceleration

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic acceleration in same reference frame as input coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
This function computes the aerodynamic acceleration. It takes primitive types as arguments to perform the calculations. Therefore, these quantities (dynamic pressure, reference area and aerodynamic coefficients) have to computed before passing them to this function.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the acceleration flies.
referenceArea
Reference area of the aerodynamic coefficients.
aerodynamicCoefficients
Aerodynamic coefficients in right-handed reference frame.
vehicleMass
Mass of vehicle undergoing acceleration.
Resultant aerodynamic acceleration, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given (assuming coefficients in positive direction).

memberdef.argsstring: (const double dynamicPressure, AerodynamicCoefficientInterfacePointer coefficientInterface, const double vehicleMass)
memberdef.name: computeAerodynamicAcceleration

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic acceleration in same reference frame as input coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
This function computes the aerodynamic acceleration. It takes the dynamic pressure and an aerodynamic coefficient interface as input. The coefficient interface has to have been updated with current vehicle conditions before being passed to this function. Aerodynamic coefficients and reference area are then retrieved from it.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the acceleration flies.
coefficientInterface
AerodynamicCoefficientInterface class from which reference area and coefficients are retrieved.
vehicleMass
Mass of vehicle undergoing acceleration.
Resultant aerodynamic acceleration, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given (assuming coefficients in positive direction).

briefdescription.para: Function to print to console which aerodynamic coefficients are being saved.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to print to console which aerodynamic coefficients are being saved.
coefficientIndices
Indices of coefficients to be saved.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double dynamicPressure, const double referenceArea, const Eigen::Vector3d &aerodynamicCoefficients)
memberdef.name: computeAerodynamicForce

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic force in same reference frame as input coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
This function calculates the aerodynamic force. It takes primitive types as arguments to perform the calculations. Therefore, these quantities (dynamicPressure, reference area and aerodynamic coefficients) have to computed before passing them to this function.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the force flies.
referenceArea
Reference area of the aerodynamic coefficients.
aerodynamicCoefficients
Aerodynamic coefficients in right-handed reference frame.
Resultant aerodynamic force, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given.

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic force in same reference frame as input coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
This function calculates the aerodynamic force. It takes the dynamic pressure and an aerodynamic coefficient interface as input. The coefficient interface has to have been updated with current vehicle conditions before being passed to this function. Aerodynamic coefficients and reference area are then retrieved from it.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the force flies.
coefficientInterface
AerodynamicCoefficientInterface class from which reference area and coefficients are retrieved.
Resultant aerodynamic force, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d(const std::vector< double > &) > &forceCoefficientFunction, const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d(const std::vector< double > &) > &momentCoefficientFunction, const std::vector< double > &independentVariables)
memberdef.name: concatenateForceAndMomentCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Function to combined the force and moment coefficients from separate function pointers.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to combined the force and moment coefficients from separate function pointers. The output is the concatenated force and moment coefficient vector, evaluated at the current set of independent variables.
forceCoefficientFunction
Function returning the aerodynamic force coefficients as function of the set of independent variables.
momentCoefficientFunction
Function returning the aerodynamic force coefficients as function of the set of independent variables.
independentVariables
Current list of values of the independent variables upon which the coefficients depend.

briefdescription.para: Compute local-to-static pressure ratio.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the local to static pressure ratio, assuming a thermally and calorically perfect gas.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
ratioOfSpecificHeats
Ratio of specific heat at constant pressure to specific heat at constant volume.
Local-to-static pressure ratio.

briefdescription.para: Compute Prandtl-Meyer function.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the value of the Prandtl-Meyer function at the given Mach number and ratio of specific heat.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
ratioOfSpecificHeats
Ratio of specific heat at constant pressure to specific heat at constant volume.

briefdescription.para: Compute stagnation pressure coefficient in supersonic flow.

Flow Mach number.
ratioOfSpecificHeats

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient based on Newtonian theory.

Computes the pressure coefficient based on Newtonian theory.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient based on modified Newtonian theory.

Computes the pressure coefficient based on modified Newtonian theory.
inclinationAngle
Angle between the wall and the freestream velocity vector.

Newtonian pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using empirical tangent wedge method.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes tangent wedge pressure coefficient based on empirical correlation for ratio of specific heats = 1.4 ( terrestrial atmosphere).
inclinationAngle
Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
Empirical tangent wedge pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using empirical tangent cone method.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes tangent cone pressure coefficient based on empirical correlation for ratio of specific heats = 1.4 ( terrestrial atmosphere).
inclinationAngle
Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
Empirical tangent wedge pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using modified Dahlem-Buck method.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes tangent cone pressure coefficient based on Dahlem-Buck empirical method.
inclinationAngle
Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.
machNumber

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using the Hankey flat surface method.

Computes tangent cone pressure coefficient based on the Hankey flat surface method.

Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using the Smyth delta wing method.

Computes tangent cone pressure coefficient based on the Smyth delta wing surface method.

Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.
machNumber

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using the van Dyke unified method.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes tangent cone pressure coefficient based on the van Dyke unified method.
inclinationAngle
Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.

( expansion ( 1 ) or compression( -1 ) ).

memberdef.argsstring: (double inclinationAngle, double machNumber, double ratioOfSpecificHeats, double freestreamPrandtlMeyerFunction)
memberdef.name: computePrandtlMeyerFreestreamPressureCoefficient

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using Prandtl-Meyer expansion.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes pressure coefficient using Prandtl-Meyer expansion from freestream. Currently only terrestrial atmosphere ( ratio of specific heat = 1.4 ) is supported due to the use of an empirical fit for the inverse Prandtl-Meyer function determination.
inclinationAngle
Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
ratioOfSpecificHeats
Ratio of specific heat at constant pressure to specific heat at constant volume.
freestreamPrandtlMeyerFunction
Freestream Prandtl-Meyer function.
Prandtl-Meyer pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient at vacuum.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the pressure coefficient at vacuum assuming a thermally and calorically perfect gas.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
ratioOfSpecificHeats
Ratio of specific heat at constant pressure to specific heat at constant volume.
Vacuum pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute high Mach base pressure coefficient.

detaileddescription.para:
This function calculates the high Mach base pressure coefficient approximation.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
Vacuum pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute pressure coefficient using the ACM empirical method.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes tangent cone pressure coefficient based on the ACM empirical method.
inclinationAngle
Angle between wall and freestream velocity vector.
machNumber
Flow Mach number.
ACM empirical surface pressure coefficient.

briefdescription.para: Compute Mach number from Prandtl-Meyer function.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the inverse of the Prandtl-Meyer function. Currently the function is limited to use with ratio of specific heats of 1.4 as it uses an empirical correlation.
prandtlMeyerFunctionValue
Prandyl-Meyer function value.
Mach number.

Computes ratio of post- to pre-shock pressure, assuming thermally and calorically perfect gas.
normalMachNumber
Mach number of flow velocity normal to shock.
ratioOfSpecificHeats

Mach number of flow velocity normal to shock.

gas constant per unit mass for flow composition.

briefdescription.para: Compute post- to pre-shock total pressure ratio.

Compute post- to pre-shock total pressure ratio from the entropy jump across a shock wave. Assumption of thermally and calorically perfect gas is made.
normalMachNumber
Mach number of flow velocity normal to shock.
ratioOfSpecificHeats
ratio of specific heat at constant pressure to specific heat at constant volume.
specificGasConstant
gas constant per unit mass for flow composition.

ratioOfSpecificHeats

memberdef.argsstring: (const double dynamicPressure, const double referenceArea, const double referenceLength, const Eigen::Vector3d &momentCoefficients)
memberdef.name: computeAerodynamicMoment

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic moment in same reference frame as input coefficients, with same reference lengths for each axis.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic moment in same reference frame as input coefficients.

This function calculates the aerodynamic moment. It takes primitive types as arguments to perform the calculations. Therefor, these quantities (dynamic pressure, reference area, reference length and aerodynamic coefficients) have to computed before passing them to this function.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the force flies.
referenceArea
Reference area of the aerodynamic coefficients.
referenceLength
Reference length of the aerodynamic coefficients. Note that this reference length is used for all three independent directions.
momentCoefficients
Aerodynamic moment coefficients in right-handed reference frame.
Resultant aerodynamic moment, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given, but with opposite sign. i.e., a positive drag coefficient will give a negative force in -x direction (in the aerodynamic frame).

memberdef.argsstring: (const double dynamicPressure, const double referenceArea, const Eigen::Vector3d &referenceLengths, const Eigen::Vector3d &momentCoefficients)
memberdef.name: computeAerodynamicMoment

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic moment in same reference frame as input coefficients, with different reference lengths for each axis.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic moment in same reference frame as input coefficients.

This function calculates the aerodynamic moment. It takes primitive types as arguments to perform the calculations. Therefor, these quantities (dynamic pressure, reference area, reference lengths and aerodynamic coefficients) have to computed before passing them to this function.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the force flies.
referenceArea
Reference area of the aerodynamic coefficients.
referenceLengths
Reference lengths of the aerodynamic coefficients, used in x, y and z directions.
momentCoefficients
Aerodynamic moment coefficients in right-handed reference frame.
Resultant aerodynamic moment, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given, but with opposite sign. i.e., a positive drag coefficient will give a negative force in -x direction (in the aerodynamic frame).

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic moment in same reference frame as input coefficients.

detaileddescription.para: Calculates the aerodynamic moment in same reference frame as input coefficients.

This function calculates the aerodynamic moment. It takes the dynamic pressure and an aerodynamic coefficient interface as input. The coefficient interface has to have been updated with current vehicle conditions before being passed to this function. Aerodynamic coefficients and reference area and length are then retrieved from it.
dynamicPressure
Dynamic pressure at which the body undergoing the force flies.
coefficientInterface
AerodynamicCoefficientInterface class from which reference area and length, and the moment coefficients are retrieved.
Resultant aerodynamic moment, given in reference frame in which the aerodynamic coefficients were given.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double altitude, const double longitude, const double latitude, const double time, const double referenceAltitude, const double densityAtReferenceAltitude, const double scaleHeight)
memberdef.name: exponentialAtmosphereModel

briefdescription.para: First atmosphere model, based on exponential atmosphere.

detaileddescription.para:
First atmosphere model, based on exponential atmosphere.
altitude
Current altitude.
longitude
Current longitude (unused).
latitude
Current latitude (unused).
time
Current time (unused).
referenceAltitude
Reference altitude.
densityAtReferenceAltitude
Density at reference altitude condition.
scaleHeight
Scale height of the atmosphere.
Density at current conditions, based on the exponential model with given characteristics.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double altitude, const double longitude, const double latitude, const double time, const double referenceAltitude, const double densityAtReferenceAltitude, const double scaleHeight, const double uncertaintyFactor, const double dustStormFactor)
memberdef.name: threeWaveAtmosphereModel

briefdescription.para: Second atmosphere model, based on a three longitudinal waves model.

detaileddescription.para:
Second atmosphere model, based on a three longitudinal waves model. The parameters for the three longitudinal waves are hard coded in the function. Based on (Justus, et al., 2004).
altitude
Current altitude.
longitude
Current longitude.
latitude
Current latitude (unused).
time
Current time (unused).
referenceAltitude
Reference altitude.
densityAtReferenceAltitude
Density at reference altitude condition.
scaleHeight
Scale height of the atmosphere.
uncertaintyFactor
Factor representing uncertainty in the atmosphere. Can be a random variable.
dustStormFactor
Factor representing presence of planet-wide dust storm (particularly useful for Mars applications).
Density at current conditions, based on the three-waves model with given characteristics.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double altitude, const double longitude, const double latitude, const double time, const double referenceAltitude, const double densityAtReferenceAltitude, const double scaleHeight, const std::vector< double > &modelWeights)
memberdef.name: threeTermAtmosphereModel

briefdescription.para: Third atmosphere model, based on three constant scale height atmospheres.

detaileddescription.para:
Third atmosphere model, based on three constant scale height atmospheres. The first term is the same as for the exponential model, whereas the other two are a sine and a cosine term. Based on (Jah, et al., 2008).
altitude
Current altitude.
longitude
Current longitude (unused).
latitude
Current latitude (unused).
time
Current time (unused).
referenceAltitude
Reference altitude.
densityAtReferenceAltitude
Density at reference altitude condition.
scaleHeight
Scale height of the atmosphere.
modelWeights
Weights for each of the three models.
Density at current conditions, based on the exponential model with given characteristics.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< double(const double) > heatTransferFunction, const double wallEmmisivity, const double adiabaticWallTemperature)
memberdef.name: computeEquilibiumWallTemperature

briefdescription.para: Function to compute the equilibrium wall temperature from the heat input and emmisivity.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to compute the equilibrium wall temperature from the heat input and emmisivity. This function calls a root- finder to determine the wall temperature where the heat input equals the radiative output.
heatTransferFunction
Function that returns the heat input as a function of current temperature
wallEmmisivity
Value of the material emmisivity
adiabaticWallTemperature
Adiabatic wall temperature. This variables is only used as an upper bound, and to generate an initial giess for the equilibrium temperature
Wall temperature at which input and output of heat are in equilibrium.

briefdescription.para: Returns default values of mach number for use in HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis.

detaileddescription.para: Returns default values of mach number for use in HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis.

briefdescription.para: Returns default values of angle of attack for use in HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis.

detaileddescription.para: Returns default values of angle of attack for use in HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis.

briefdescription.para: Returns default values of angle of sideslip for use in HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::shared_ptr< HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis > localInclinationAnalysis, const std::string directory, const std::string filePrefix)
memberdef.name: saveVehicleMeshToFile

briefdescription.para: Function that saves the vehicle mesh data used for a HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis to a file.

detaileddescription.para:
Function that saves the vehicle mesh data used for a HypersonicLocalInclinationAnalysis to a file: specifically, the panel centroids and surface normals, to file names: <directory>/<filePrefix>"ShapeFile.dat" <directory>/<filePrefix>"SurfaceNormalFile.dat" with directory and filePrefix input variables.
localInclinationAnalysis
Aerodynamic analysis object
directory
Directory to which the files are to be saved
filePrefix
File name prefix that is to be used

memberdef.argsstring: (const double altitude, const double longitude, const double latitude, const double time, const tudat::input_output::solar_activity::SolarActivityDataMap &solarActivityMap, const bool adjustSolarTime=false, const double localSolarTime=0.0)
memberdef.name: nrlmsiseInputFunction

briefdescription.para: NRLMSISE00 Input function.

detaileddescription.para: NRLMSISE00Input function.

This function is used to define the input for the NRLMSISE model. This function reads solar activity data and defines the input using this data.
altitude
Altitude at which output is to be computed [m].
longitude
Longitude at which output is to be computed [rad].
latitude
Latitude at which output is to be computed [rad].
time
Time at which output is to be computed (seconds since J2000).
solarActivityMap
SolarActivityData structure
adjustSolarTime
Boolean denoting whether the computed local solar time should be overidden with localSolarTime input.
localSolarTime
Local solar time that is used when adjustSolarTime is set to true.
NRLMSISE00Input nrlmsiseInputFunction

briefdescription.para: Check uniqueness of input.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to check uniqueness of input for (in)dependent variables. The function works by checking that there are no duplicates, after having sorted the vector. For this reason, a local copy of the input vector is taken.
VariableType
Type belonging to the input vector.
variables
Vector of variables which needs to be checked.

briefdescription.para: Convert AerodynamicCoefficientsIndependentVariables to json.
Convert json to AerodynamicCoefficientsIndependentVariables.
Convert AtmosphereIndependentVariables to json.
Convert json to AtmosphereIndependentVariables.

Convert json to AtmosphereDependentVariables.
Function to set the angle of attack to trimmed conditions.
Overloaded ostream to print class information.
Function to convert Eigen::VectorXd to std::vector<double>
